Title: "Advanced OData Filtering and Search in Azure AI"
Text:
C:\Users\adamh\Downloads\azure-search.pdfPhrasescontain spaces, which is a default delimiter. You can specify an alternative delimiter insingle quotes as the third string parameter:odata-filter-exprFind all hotels with name equal to either 'Sea View motel' or 'Budget hotel' separated by'|'):odata-filter-exprFind all hotels with rooms that have the tag 'wifi' or 'tub':odata-filter-exprFind a match on phrases within a collection, such as 'heated towel racks' or 'hairdryerincluded' in tags.
odata-filter-exprPerformance of search.inExamples    search.in(HotelName, 'Sea View motel,Budget hotel', ',')    search.in(HotelName, 'Sea View motel|Budget hotel', '|')    Rooms/any(room: room/Tags/any(tag: search.
in(tag, 'wifi, tub')))Find all hotels without the tag 'motel' or 'cabin':odata-filter-exprFilters in Azure AI SearchOData expression language overview for Azure AI SearchOData expression syntax reference for Azure AI SearchSearch Documents (Azure AI Search REST API)    Rooms/any(room: room/Tags/any(tag: search.
in(tag, 'heated towel racks,hairdryer included', ','))    Tags/all(tag: not search.in(tag, 'motel, cabin'))Next stepsOData search.score function in AzureAI SearchArticle•11/15/2023When you send a query to Azure AI Search without the $orderby parameter, the resultsthat come back will be sorted in descending order by relevance score. Even when youdo use $orderby, the relevance score is used to break ties by default. However,sometimes it's useful to use the relevance score as an initial sort criteria, and some othercriteria as the tie-breaker. The example in this article demonstrates using thesearch.score function for sorting.
